p: Initial structural models were constructed by using modeller [ 29]. In some cases, the resultant models contain residues with rare dihedral angles (Ramachandran outliers), rare shape of side chains (rotamer outliers), and short atomâ€“atom distances (atomic crashes). Then, the models were further modified by iteratively applying molecular dynamics and geometry minimization procedures of phenix [ 30] to eliminate aforementioned outliers, and finally, manual model modifications with visual inspection on COOT for resolving rotamer outliers or atomic crashes [ 31]. The model quality was evaluated with molprobity [ 32]. The percentages of rotamer outlier, Ramachandran outlier, and crash score were monitored for each model to achieve less than 2%, 0.05%, and 5, respectively.
